_header: God that died for mans need / Give us grace will to speed
Note:
Part of the ‘Continuation’ of Handlyng Synne (1283), for which see Sullivan (1978)
XSullivan, S. A. “Handlyng Synne in Its Tradition: A Study of Robert Mannyng of Brunne’s Handlyng Synne and Its Relation to Other Instructional Works, in Order to Establish the Place of the Poem in Its Genre.” Diss. Cambridge, 1978. Other sections are 378, 3099, 3339, 3355, 3358; and cf. 2932.
_description: A treatise on Shrift and the Deadly Sins, illustrated by exempla

CULIi49.First Lines:
God þat deyd for mannys nedeȝeue vs grace wyl to
                    spede…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…If þat þu wylt ben clene of in lyfOn thys maner
                    þu do þe schryve
